title: Removal of executive in parliamentary system

content.prompt: Which of the following is an effect of fused executive and legislative branches in parliamentary systems?

choices.label: The executive and legislative branches often have different policy goals.
The judiciary has little to no power or impact as a political institution.
The citizens have a more difficult time following political processes.
The legislature can remove the executive without an impeachment proceeding.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
